properties.headline: High Surf Warning issued February 11 at 3:48AM HST until February 11 at 12:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu HI
properties.description:
...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU
KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI...NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI...AND WEST
FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND...

.The combination of 2 large northwest to north-northwest swells,
will continue to produce large and dangerous surf along most
north and west facing shores this morning. In addition, significant
beach erosion, overwash onto vulnerable low-lying coastal roadways,
and surges within north and west facing harbors such as Haleiwa
and Waianae will be possible this morning. The swells will begin
to lower by late morning, with a steady decline expected this
afternoon through tonight. Surf will likely remain at advisory
levels this afternoon along most north and west facing shores
however, while the surf is expected to remain at warning levels
along west facing shores of the Big Island through the day.

* WHAT...Surf will be 18 to 25 feet early this morning, lowering
to 12 to 16 feet by late this afternoon, along north and west
facing shores of Niihau and Kauai, as well as north facing
shores of Oahu, Molokai, and Maui. Surf will be 12 to 20 feet
early this morning, lowering to 8 to 12 feet by late this
afternoon along west facing shores of Oahu and Molokai.

* WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu,
Molokai, and north facing shores of Maui.

* WHEN...Until noon HST today.

* IMPACTS...High. Expect ocean water occasionally sweeping
across portions of beaches, very strong breaking waves, and
strong longshore and rip currents. Breaking waves may
occasionally impact harbors making navigating the harbor
channel dangerous.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of onshore winds, large
surf, and peak monthly tides could result in significant beach
erosion, flooding of beaches that normally remain dry and
overwash onto vulnerable low-lying coastal roads and other
coastal infrastructure.
properties.instruction:
Large, breaking surf, significant shorebreak, and dangerous
currents make entering the water very hazardous.

Anyone entering the water could face significant injury or death.

NWSheadline: HIGH SURF WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON HST TODAY
